meanings.definition: Not appropriate or suitable for the time of year.
meanings.sent1: The unseasonable snow in July surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: Wearing a heavy coat in the summer would be unseasonable.
meanings.sent3: It would be unseasonable to bring a beach umbrella to a snowball fight.
meanings.sent4: Her unseasonable choice of Halloween costume in April raised some eyebrows.
meanings.sent5: The unseasonable heatwave turned the winter wonderland into a summer paradise.

meanings.definition: Happening at an inappropriate or inconvenient time.
meanings.sent1: The unseasonable arrival of the pizza delivery interrupted the meeting.
meanings.sent2: Getting a flat tire on the way to an important meeting was unseasonable bad luck.
meanings.sent3: The unseasonable power outage during the movie made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His unseasonable proposal at her grandmother's funeral shocked everyone.
meanings.sent5: The unseasonable rain during the wedding ceremony brought good luck according to folklore.
